result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip J Breckman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Philip J Breckman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Philip J Breckman was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Philip J Breckman appeared with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.
9:00 am Court recites case & app; plea ? - tendered - court goes thru form w/deft; Atty D - Ct. 2 - NC; Deft pleads NC - found guilty, Ct. 1 dismissed;
DA - statement - fine $299; Atty D - jt recommendation; Deft - statement; Court - $299.00 60 DTP, $250 DNA surcharge, 15 TR 686 dismissed.  DA ?'s 15 TR 686.  Counsel goes and
talks.  Adj'd 9:05 am
9:08 am Back on record - 15 TR 686 - reopened; DA advised dismissal not part of agreement; Atty D - NC plea - found guilty; $887.50, 6 pts, 6 mo, AODA, driver's safety plan, IID not required.
DA - Sp PD requests rest. $83.00 for blood draw; Atty D - statement; Court so ordered rest. of $83.00.   Restitution payable direct to Spooner PD.  Adj'd 9:10 a.m.

Attorney Thomas W Duffy appeared by phone means for Defendant Philip J Breckman. Prosecuting Atty Thomas H Frost appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Philip J Breckman in court. Court calls case and appearances.  Set for plea/sentencing.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Thomas W Duffy appeared by phone means for Defendant Philip J Breckman. Prosecuting Atty Angeline E Winton appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Philip J Breckman in court.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Duffy speaks to the court.  Also has 15 TR 686.  Set out for more time. Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Philip J Breckman in court, in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  State offers Mr. Breckman a copy of the criminal complaint.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.   Court speaks to the def.  Warrant is quashed.  Same bail condtions apply.
Defendant Philip J Breckman not in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance. Bench warrant issued.
$1000 SB; no alcohol, no bars, no controlled substances unless prescribed by lic'd physician, not to operate a motor vehicle w/o valid permit, return Aug 31 at 10 a.m.
